intro: Ceropegia chrysantha, commonly known as the yellow ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and fleshy leaves. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that are tubular in shape and attract specific pollinators like moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate sunlight, making it suitable for indoor cultivation. Due to its ornamental value, it is often grown as a houseplant or in rock gardens.
